Content-type: text/plain

Using todays CVS, we're having some problems with the seed regexp,
(?i:(http(s)?://\\w+)|(\\w+\\.\\w+)(\\.\\w+)*(:\\d+)?(/\\S*)?),
in util/SeedsInputIterator.java.

For seeds like http://www.foo.br/ it gave http://www, since '.' isn't in
\w.  Additionally, sites with '-' in them cannot be seeds, as that isn't
in \w either.  Is the intention that anything after http[s] is allowed,
but otherwise we look for hostnames?  It is also poorly defined in the
Java docs what the precedence is, so the extent of the | is uncertain. 
I propose

(?i:(?:(https?://[a-zA-Z0-9-]+)|([a-zA-Z0-9-]+\\.[a-zA-Z0-9-]+))(\\.[a-zA-Z0-9-]+)*(\\.\\w+)(:\\d+)?(/\\S*)?)

which allows things starting with http[s], if they contain any legal
two- or more level domains plus optional ports and stuff, or if they
contain any legal three- or more level domain plus optional ports and
stuff.  Patch for this attached.

I also notice that there's a null pointer except on any non-matched
name, but that seems to be something with the logging system.

-Lars


--Boundary_(ID_q44Sm7PmHQ6sHuECdn4qKg)
Content-type: text/x-patch; name=regexp; charset=UTF-8
